main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Drummond, Wisconsin on 16-17 May 1958, involving a round, white object that was initially believed to be a star.
interesting points: The object was reported to be the size of a nickel, bright and twinkling, and moved back and forth but was ultimately determined to be stationary, The sighting lasted approximately 1.5 hours, The observer initially believed the object to be a star and took photographs that failed to capture it, Reports indicate that the object did not resemble any aircraft and made no sound, Weather conditions were clear at the time of the sighting.
witness description: Mrs. Jack Hanson, a housewife from Drummond
